page.title: 16Customs in Canterbury
page.content: There are many interesting customs and{traditions}in Canterbury. Every day at 11.00 am the bell in the Cathedral rings to remember those killed in{wars,}and a soldier turns a page of the book where the names of the dead are listed. At{Christmas,}carols are sung around a Christmas tree. There is also a Victorian steam organ that plays carols to raise money for charity. At this time hand bell ringers can be seen playing in the Buttermarket. {Morris dancers}often perform in the Longmarket and on Saturdays the town crier in an 18th century costume announces such events.
